page.title: 04THE SHOP IN L. STAUGHTON
page.content: The General Store and {Post Office}is on the road which runs through Little Staughton. It has a wide range of groceries and bread. It sells a good selection of fresh vegetables and fruit some of which are grown locally.It is also licensed to sell alcohol.Newspapers and magazines are sold and there is a noticeboard for people to advertise goods for sale.The store has been modernised recently.The {Post Office}is very important in a village because people can buy stamps and post their letters and parcels locally. State benefits are also paid out at the Post Office. The older villagers cannot always get to the shop in bad weather so the shopkeeper delivers orders to their homes.There is a dry cleaning and shoe repair service. The{Parish Council {noticeboard}is outside the shop.
